article: Once upon a time, there was a golden songbird that lived in a beautiful garden. It spent all its days singing the loveliest songs to _ all the people who heard it. But the _ of the garden desired to have the little songster, and one day he made a cunning net in which he _ it. The little bird begged the gardener to set it free. It _ to tell him three great secrets if only he would let it go. Now that the gardener really was a very greedy man, he _ set the bird free. Then the songbird told him its three _ : never believe all that you _ , never regret what you have never lost and _ throw away which you have in your keeping. The gardener was very _ when he heard this. He said he had already known these so-called "secrets". And he shouted that the bird had _ him. But the songbird quietly replied that _ the gardener had really known these secrets, or only the _ of them, he would never have let it go. Then the bird added, "I have a most _ jewel weighing over three ounces hidden inside me. Whoever _ that jewel will have every wish granted." _ hearing this, the gardener cursed himself for _ the songbird. But the bird explained that since it weighed no more than half an ounce at most, it was _ that so big a jewel could be hidden within its tiny body. The gardener lunged at the bird in _ anger, but it flew to a nearby branch and said _ , "You never had the 60 _ in your hands, but you are already regretting what you never lost and believing what I told you. You threw it away by setting me free."
